topic: Live Debate Viewer with Shareable Permalinks
conclusion: A real-time web interface that visualizes multi-agent debates as they happen, generating unique shareable URLs for each debate session. Extends the existing export/static_html.py artifact export system, adds WebSocket streaming to push rounds in real-time, and generates permalink slugs. Implementation scope: ~300 lines Python (WebSocket server + permalink generation), ~200 lines HTML/JS (viewer component).

topic: Airlock Resilience Layer for Agent Failures
conclusion: A defensive wrapper (AirlockProxy) for agents providing Circuit Breaking (timeouts via asyncio.wait_for) and Sanitization (null byte stripping, JSON repair). Transforms aragora from a fragile system that crashes when an agent fails, into a resilient system that observes failures and continues. Implementation in aragora/agents/airlock.py with injection via AgentFactory.

topic: Public Debate Archive with Stabilized IDs
conclusion: A system to expose completed debates publicly with stable, predictable IDs. Fixes the critical loop_id bug that breaks multi-loop scenarios. Creates natural growth loops through shareable debate replays. Minimal implementation (~150 LOC) building directly on existing infrastructure.

Refactor monolithic stream.py (2500+ LOC) into modular package structure: servers.py (WebSocket server classes), broadcaster.py (event broadcasting), state_manager.py (connection state), loop_manager.py (loop lifecycle), message_handlers.py (message routing), serializers.py (event serialization). Improves maintainability and testability.

Implement weighted voting based on ELO ratings and calibration scores. Agents with higher accuracy get more influence on final consensus. Support for judge-based, majority, and supermajority consensus modes. Early stopping when consensus threshold reached.
